intro: Vigna radiata, commonly known as urd bean or tongue bean, is an annual legume native to South and Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and elongated, cylindrical pods that contain several edible seeds. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in warm, tropical climates. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, and it is known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, improving soil fertility. Vigna radiata is widely cultivated for its high protein content and is used in various culinary and traditional medicinal applications.
